description: not launching in ubuntu 18.4 lts
Anyone else have this problem
crashes on startup
Does not recognize SDRplay....

check your python version to 2.7  
sudo ln -s /usr/bin/python2.7 /usr/bin/python
Installs perfectly in 18.04.4

Does not install "Sources" or "Sinks" and therefore cannot be used for anything useful other than a momentary exercise in connect the dots in the graphical code editor. I'm not here to grind an axe. I put in a huge effort to get this to work to no avail. One star is a generous concession to necessity in order to post a negative comment. Ubuntu 18.04.
Ran it, looked ok, didn't do much, not sure if it'll connect to my BCT246.. used to have an old T1000 that would have been geat, but lost it some years back in a move.
Ubuntu 20.04 LTS updated from 18.04 LTS. Seems to work on a clean install of 20.04 LTS though. Not sure what the difference is that stops it.
Not launching in 18.04
I installed it with apt install and works like charm, including also sources and sinks...

One of the reasons I use Ubuntu let alone Gnuradio is the creation of a complete all band all mode Transciever project I have developed. It has been working very well for three years. And I have upgraded my system throughout the development process. When it became available, I allowed my system to be upgraded to Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (Focal Fossal) and the latest Gnuradio Companion. Ubuntu 20.04 LTS works well. However Gnuradio does NOT. It now has curved lines for connectors and a lot of my links between modules broke and were missing due to the removal of depreciated modules. After reinstallation of all the updated Source modules, it will NOT compile with any of my previously installed Source modules. I did get upgraded source modules imported into Gnuradio correctly, including OsmoSDR and RTL-SDR Or RTL-SDR (RTL2832U). Still no good. On top of that all of the depreciated modules have been totally removed. I have also imported all of the Python links reported in the Compilation script. No good. My only option is to format and start over with 18.04 Bionic Beaver and an older version of Gnuradio.
summary: Does not load any OOT modules and has broken links

description:
Just installed and worked. I really don't understand why there are so many 1 star reports. It really does not get any easier than this. I had an FM radio up and running in under 20 mins with a little help from the HackRF One website.

Don't be put off by the bad reviews!
Creating and installing an OOT is pretty smooth. However, running it on this install package is a literal nightmare.
great SDR software
Missing components for using it with Hackrf. And wiki page is not really helpful with problems like this more like the opposite.

Removing one star for removing packet encoder and not providinbg replacement.

Otherwise really good for SDR dev
summary: Sad about packet encoder, but otherwise really good app

description: me dice que tiene dependencias
Muy intuitivo y fácil de usar. Excelente para el análisis de señales.
Me indica que no se puede instalar, Me dice que: "No se pudo bloquear /var/lib/dphg/lock-frontend-open. (11:Recurso no disponible temporalmente)
fonctione pas

Voici le message indiqué lorsque je tente de l'installer sur mon raspberry tournant sous ubuntu (à jour).
  "impossible d'installer "GNU Radio Companion": E: dpkg a été interrompu. Il est nécessaire d'utiliser "d
pkg -- configure -a" pour corriger le problème.
Sauf que je débute sous ubuntu et je ne sais pas ce que cela veut dire.

Se lance et s'arrete immediatement sans aucune indication donc impossible a remedier.
Dommage cela fonctionnait bien jusqu'aux versions3.7.Mais attention a partir de 3.8
les cles rtl sdr n'etaient plus supportées donc inutilisables(en attendant peut-etre une modification des drivers).Conclusion Restez bien en V3.7

Fonctionne super bien, rien à redire. Les systèmes UHD sont directement pris en charge sans trop de galère. 

Il suffit juste de mettre à jour les pilotes des périphériques utilisés conformement à leurs documentations. Et tout est bon.
NICE SOFTWARE for hackrf
